main event: Two civilian observers saw a brilliant white spherical object suspended in the sky over Peoria, Illinois, on 17 August 1953.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a baseball and hovered for about 20 minutes before slowly moving away., Personnel from the 791st AC&W Squadron reported observing a half-moon shaped object in the same vicinity., No trail or exhaust was observed from the object., Checks with local airfields and weather stations determined that there were no aircraft or weather balloons in the area at the time., The conclusion of the report suggested the possibility that the sighting could be attributed to a balloon.
witness description: two civilian observers at different locations
